intro: Krynitzkia stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf krynitzkia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features opposite, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in whorls, displaying shades of purple and blue. Krynitzkia stricta thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
